com.nokia.maps.kml

Interface ColorStyle

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IconStyle, LineStyle, PolyStyle

    public interface ColorStyle
    This interface represents the abstract <ColorStyle> tag from KML specification. It provides elements for specifying the color and color mode of extended style types.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String COLOR
      This constant defines an XML attribute for the color definition.
      static java.lang.String COLOR_MODE
      This constant defines an XML attribute for the Color Mode.
      static java.lang.String MODE_NORMAL
      This constant defines a normal color mode.
      static java.lang.String MODE_RANDOM
      This constant defines a random color mode.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getColor()
      This method retrieves the preferred color of a <ColorStyle>
      java.lang.String getColorMode()
      This method retrieves the colorMode of a <ColorStyle>

    • Field Detail

      • COLOR

        static final java.lang.String COLOR
        This constant defines an XML attribute for the color definition.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COLOR_MODE

        static final java.lang.String COLOR_MODE
        This constant defines an XML attribute for the Color Mode.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MODE_NORMAL

        static final java.lang.String MODE_NORMAL
        This constant defines a normal color mode. A normal color mode does not alter the base color.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MODE_RANDOM

        static final java.lang.String MODE_RANDOM
        This constant defines a random color mode. A random color mode applies a random linear scale to the base color.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        java.lang.String getColor()
        This method retrieves the preferred color of a <ColorStyle>
        Returns:
        The color and opacity (alpha) values are expressed in hexadecimal notation. The range of values for any one color is 0 to 255 (00 to ff). For alpha, 00 is fully transparent and ff is fully opaque. The order of expression is aabbggrr, where aa=alpha (00 to ff); bb=blue (00 to ff); gg=green (00 to ff); rr=red (00 to ff).

      • getColorMode

        java.lang.String getColorMode()
        This method retrieves the colorMode of a <ColorStyle>
        Returns:
        The colorMode of this ColorStyle Values for <colorMode> are normal (no effect) and random. A value of random applies a random linear scale to the base <color> as follows.
